images.title: Trevor Harris / Bateman's House, Lathkill Dale
images.caption: Bateman's House, Lathkill. Dale Bateman's house (named for the mine owner who built it and lived here) was built directly over the 12m deep shaft used for draining the nearby lead mines.

images.title: Conksbury Bridge and the River Lathkill by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Conksbury Bridge and the River Lathkill. A Grade II listed bridge.

images.title: Row17 / River Lathkill near Conksbury
images.caption: River Lathkill near Conksbury. This beautiful area is located just south of Over Haddon.

description: This delightful little village sits in a lovely location in the Derbyshire Peak District. It's a popular place to start a walk with a good sized public car park, a nice local pub and easy access to Lathkill Dale , one of the area highlights. Here you can enjoy little waterfalls and weirs with lots of wildlife to look out for on the way. This circular walk from the village explores the dale before picking up the Limestone Way to visit neighbouring Youlgreave and Alport. Here you can pick up another riverside trail heading to the ancient Conksbury Bridge before returning to the village.
